newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thailand's Star Refining restarted RFCC on March 2.
newsitem.headline: Thailand's Star Refining restarted RFCC on March 2.

text.p: Thailand's Star Petroleum Refining Co (SPRC) restarted a 37,000-barrel-per-day residual fluid catalytic cracker (RFCC) on March 21 after a near two-week unscheduled shutdown, the company said on Wednesday.
"SPRC's RFCC started up a few days early on March 21," the company said in reply to a Reuters written enquiry.
The company had earlier said it would restart the unit on March 24. The RFCC produces mainly gasoline and liquefied petroleum gas.
SPRC said that it has no further shutdowns planned during 1997.

The company, a 60:40 joint-venture between Caltex, a joint-venture between U.S. majors Chevron Corp and Texaco Inc and state-owned Petroleum Authority of Thailand (PTT), operates a 130,000-bpd refinery in Rayong, on the eastern Thai seaboard.
